Operation 'tasks.tasks.move' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Missing summary entirely. Description is comprehensive but could clarify that it returns the updated task object. Summary needed to help AI agents quickly identify this as a task repositioning operation.

data.current_description: Moves the specified task to another position in the destination task list. If the destination list is not specified, the task is moved within its current list. This can include putting it as a child task under a new parent and/or move it to a different position among its sibling tasks. A user can have up to 2,000 subtasks per task.
data.summary_suggestion: Move task to new position or list
data.description_suggestion: Moves the specified task to another position in the destination task list, or within its current list if no destination is specified. Supports repositioning tasks among siblings and establishing parent-child relationships (subtasks). A user can have up to 2,000 subtasks per task. Returns the updated task object.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is comprehensive but could clarify that it returns the updated task object. Summary needed to help AI agents quickly identify this as a task repositioning operation.

data.current_description: Returns all the authenticated user's task lists. A user can have up to 2000 lists at a time.

data.current_description: Creates a new task list and adds it to the authenticated user's task lists. A user can have up to 2000 lists at a time.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new task list and adds it to the authenticated user's task lists. Accepts a TaskList object with the list name and optional properties. A user can have up to 2000 lists at a time. Returns the newly created TaskList object.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks input details (what TaskList properties are expected) and output details (returns created TaskList). Added clarity on request/response schemas for AI agent usability.

message: Operation 'tasks.tasklists.delete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_side_effects. Missing summary. Description has important side effects but could emphasize the cascading deletion behavior and permanence more clearly for AI agents to understand the full impact of this destructive operation.

data.current_description: Deletes the authenticated user's specified task list. If the list contains assigned tasks, both the assigned tasks and the original tasks in the assignment surface (Docs, Chat Spaces) are deleted.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes the authenticated user's specified task list. Important: If the list contains assigned tasks, both the assigned tasks and the original tasks in the assignment surface (Docs, Chat Spaces) are deleted. This action is permanent and cannot be undone.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description has important side effects but could emphasize the cascading deletion behavior and permanence more clearly for AI agents to understand the full impact of this destructive operation.

message: Operation 'tasks.tasks.list' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about available filtering/pagination options despite 12 parameters. Added summary and enhanced description to indicate parameter availability for AI agent decision-making. Fixed typo 'be default' to 'by default'.

data.current_description: Returns all tasks in the specified task list. Does not return assigned tasks be default (from Docs, Chat Spaces). A user can have up to 20,000 non-hidden tasks per list and up to 100,000 tasks in total at a time.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve all tasks from a task list
data.description_suggestion: Returns all tasks in the specified task list. By default, does not return tasks assigned from Docs or Chat Spaces. Supports filtering, sorting, and pagination through optional parameters. A user can have up to 20,000 non-hidden tasks per list and up to 100,000 tasks in total at a time.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about available filtering/pagination options despite 12 parameters. Added summary and enhanced description to indicate parameter availability for AI agent decision-making. Fixed typo 'be default' to 'by default'.

data.current_description: Creates a new task on the specified task list. Tasks assigned from Docs or Chat Spaces cannot be inserted from Tasks Public API; they can only be created by assigning them from Docs or Chat Spaces. A user can have up to 20,000 non-hidden tasks per list and up to 100,000 tasks in total at a time.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new task in a task list
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new task on the specified task list. Tasks assigned from Docs or Chat Spaces cannot be inserted via this API; they can only be created by assigning them from those sources. Returns the newly created Task object. A user can have up to 20,000 non-hidden tasks per list and up to 100,000 tasks in total at a time.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks explicit mention of return value (newly created Task object). Added summary and clarified return behavior for better AI agent interpretability regarding what to expect after successful creation.

data.summary_suggestion: Delete a task from a task list

data.current_description: Updates the specified task.
data.summary_suggestion: Replace a task with updated data
data.description_suggestion: Updates the specified task using full replacement semantics. The entire Task object in the request body replaces the existing task; all fields must be provided. Returns the updated Task object. Use PATCH for partial updates or PUT for complete replacement.

Operation 'tasks.tasks.move' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Missing summary entirely. Description is comprehensive but could clarify that it returns the updated task object. Summary needed to help AI agents quickly identify this as a task repositioning operation.

data.current_description: Moves the specified task to another position in the destination task list. If the destination list is not specified, the task is moved within its current list. This can include putting it as a child task under a new parent and/or move it to a different position among its sibling tasks. A user can have up to 2,000 subtasks per task.
data.summary_suggestion: Move task to new position or list
data.description_suggestion: Moves the specified task to another position in the destination task list, or within its current list if no destination is specified. Supports repositioning tasks among siblings and establishing parent-child relationships (subtasks). A user can have up to 2,000 subtasks per task. Returns the updated task object.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is comprehensive but could clarify that it returns the updated task object. Summary needed to help AI agents quickly identify this as a task repositioning operation.
